meanings.sent1: Last night, I had a nightmare about being chased by a giant spider.
meanings.sent2: She woke up screaming from the nightmare she had about falling off a cliff.
meanings.sent3: Even though it was just a nightmare, I couldn't shake off the feeling of fear.
meanings.sent4: The nightmare of failing the test haunted her thoughts all day.
meanings.sent5: The nightmare felt so real, she could still hear the monster's growls.

meanings.definition: A person, thing, or situation that is very difficult to deal with.
meanings.sent1: Dealing with my boss's constant demands is a real nightmare.
meanings.sent2: Fixing this broken car engine is turning out to be a nightmare.
meanings.sent3: Trying to untangle the Christmas lights was a complete nightmare.
meanings.sent4: The nightmare of organizing the event made her want to give up.
meanings.sent5: The group project turned into a nightmare when nobody agreed on a plan.

meanings.definition: An experience that is very difficult or unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: Going through a breakup can be an emotional nightmare.
meanings.sent2: The long wait at the airport turned into a nightmare due to the delays.
meanings.sent3: Trying to assemble the furniture became a nightmare without the instructions.
meanings.sent4: The nightmare of losing her wallet in a foreign country left her feeling helpless.
meanings.sent5: The nightmare of getting lost in the forest made her appreciate having a map.
